SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am52
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am52.model.playingBoards

Class PlayingBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am52.model.playingBoards.PlayingBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
ItemsProvider, ResourcesProvider, BoardInfo
public class PlayingBoard extends Object implements BoardInfo
The playing board of a player. The playing board is created from the starter card. Then, Kingdom cards (Gold or Resource) can be placed in available slots. The playing board keep track of the available (visible) resources and items, and the locations of each placed card (in order to validate patterns for objective points).

  • Field Details

    • starterCard

      private final StarterCardFace starterCard
      The root card of the playing board.

    • placedCards

      private final Map<BoardSlot,KingdomCardFace> placedCards
      The hash map that keep track of all placed cards. Each time a card is placed on the playing bord, the card must be added to this map together with its location (BoardSlot).

      This collection does not contain the starter card.

    • availableSlots

      private final Set<BoardSlot> availableSlots
      The set of available locations, where a new card can be placed. Every time a new card is placed on the playing board, this collection must be updated to remove the occupied slot and add any additional slots.

    • resources

      private ResourcesCounter resources
      The available (visible) resources on the playing board. Every time a new card is placed on the playing board, this counter must be updated subtracting the resource that the new card hides and adding the new resources visible on the new card.

    • items

      private ItemsCounter items
      The available (visible) items on the playing board. Every time a new card is placed on the playing board, this counter must be updated subtracting the item that the new card hides and adding the new items visible on the new card.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayingBoard

      public PlayingBoard(StarterCardFace starterCard)
      Creates a new playing board, with the specified starter card as the initial root.
      Parameters:
      starterCard - The starer card representing the root of the playing board.

  • Method Details

    • getNeighborCard

      private static Optional<KingdomCardFace> getNeighborCard(Map<BoardSlot,KingdomCardFace> cards, BoardSlot refSlot, RelativeLocation location)
      This method takes a Map of placed cards and their positions, and return the (optional) card placed at the specified neighbor position relative to the specified reference board slot. If there isn't any card at the neighbor slot position, the method returns an Optional.empty() instance.

      This method is static because it is used also by the nexted class PlayingBoardInfo.

      Parameters:
      cards - A Map of placed cards and their slot position.
      refSlot - The reference slot position.
      location - The location of the card to get, relative to the reference slot.
      Returns:
      The card placed at the specified location. If there is non cord at the specified location, the method returns an Optional.Empty().

    • getNeighborCard

      private static Optional<KingdomCardFace> getNeighborCard(Map<BoardSlot,KingdomCardFace> cards, BoardSlot refSlot, CornerLocation location)
      This method takes a Map of placed cards and their positions, and return the (optional) card placed at the specified neighbor position at the corner relative to the specified reference board slot. If there isn't any card at the neighbor slot position, the method returns an Optional.empty() instance.

      This method is static because it is used also by the nexted class PlayingBoardInfo.

      Parameters:
      cards - A Map of placed cards and their slot position.
      refSlot - The reference slot position.
      location - The corner location of the card to get, relative to the reference slot.
      Returns:
      The card placed at the specified location. If there is non cord at the specified location, the method returns an Optional.Empty().

    • getStarerCard

      public StarterCardFace getStarerCard()
      Returns:
      The starter card face that is the root of this playing board.

    • getInfo

      public BoardInfo getInfo()
      Returns:
      An immutable object containing the info of this playing board.

    • placeCard

      public int placeCard(BoardSlot location, KingdomCardFace card) throws PlayingBoardException
      Place a card on an available location on the playing board and returns the points gained by the player. The status of the playing board is updated as follows:
      • The specified location is removed from the collection of the available slots
      • Eventually, new slots are added to the collection of available slots
      • The resources counter is updated, taking into consideration resources hidden by the placed card and new resources visible on the placed card.
      • The items counter is updated, taking into consideration items hidden by the placed card and new items visible on the placed card.
      Parameters:
      location - The location on the playing board where the card is placed.
      card - The card to place.
      Returns:
      The points gained by the player.
      Throws:
      PlayingBoardException - If the specified location is not an available location on the playing board or the specified card cannot be placed (i.e. there are no required resources, and the method conPlace() of the card instance returns false).

    • findHiddenCorners

      private List<CardCorner> findHiddenCorners(BoardSlot slot)
      When a card is placed on a slot in the playing board, it hides at least one corner of another card previously placed on the playing board. But, in particular circumstances, the placed card can hide more corners. This method check all slots at positioned at the corners of the placed card, and return a list with all hidden corners.
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot where the new card is placed.
      Returns:
      A list of corners hidden by placing the new card on the playing board, on the specified slot.

    • findNewAvailableSlots

      private List<BoardSlot> findNewAvailableSlots(BoardSlot location)
      Get a list of available slots at the corner positions of the specified board location. If the specified board location does not have a card placed on it, the method return an empty list.
      Parameters:
      location - The location to check.
      Returns:
      The list of available location, linkable to this location.

    • isLinkable

      private boolean isLinkable(BoardSlot location, CornerLocation cornerLocation)
      Checks if an empty location of the playing board can be linked to its neighbor location at the specified corner. It only checks if:
      • The location is not the root location of the playing board
      • The neighbor location at the corner do not have a card
      • The neighbor location at corner have a card, but with a visible linkable corner.
      Parameters:
      location - The location to check.
      cornerLocation - The location of the corner to check.
      Returns:
      True if the location is linkable.

    • isLinkable

      private boolean isLinkable(BoardSlot location)
      Checks if the specified location of this playing board can be linked to all its neighbor location, i.e. if it is possible to place a card on that location.

      This method does not check the absolute meaning of 'linkable', because it does NOT if there is at least one card placed at the corner of the location, in order to link the placed card to that card. For this method, an empty location that does not have any card placed around it is linkable.

      Parameters:
      location - The board location to check.
      Returns:
      True if it is possible to place a card on the specified location, false otherwise.

    • removeInvalidatedSlots

      private void removeInvalidatedSlots(BoardSlot location)
      Check if the card placed on the specified slot has a hidden corner that invalidate an available location.
      Parameters:
      location - The location where is placed the card that can invalidate neighbor available location.

    • getHiddenCorner

      private Optional<CardCorner> getHiddenCorner(BoardSlot refSlot, CornerLocation location)
      Check if the card positioned on the specified slot hides the corner of another card at the specified corner. If there isn't a card on the slot linked to the specified corner, the method returns an Optional.empty() value.

      If there is a card on the linked slot, its corner is visible due to the rules of card placement. Thus, the getXxxCorner() method on the card instance return a non-empty value.

      Parameters:
      refSlot - The slot where the card is placed.
      location - The corner location to check.
      Returns:
      The (optional) corner hidden by the card.
